intro: Menonvillea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered menonvillea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing in rocky or forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
